doc.name: capStyle

syntax.example: set the capStyle [of graphic] to style

doc.summary: Specifies how the ends of lines and dashes are drawn.

examples.example: set the capStyle of graphic "dashedRectangle1" to "round"

description.overview: Set the capStyle property to specify how the ends of lines and dashes are drawn.

option.description: Lines are ended by a half-circle centred at the end-point of the line. This is the default.
The edge is extended beyond the end-point by half the line width.

description.value: The capStyle property returns one of "butt", "square" or "round".
description.comments:
Setting the capStyle property changes the appearance of line and dash ends for graphic objects.
This only affects polygon, freehand curve and line graphics which have their antialiased set to true.
